body: Note that OJDBC drivers are now available via maven via the Oracle Maven Repository - https://blogs.oracle.com/dev2dev/get-oracle-jdbc-drivers-and-ucp-from-oracle-maven-repository-without-ides .  So this means you don't need to have the extra install step, but it is a good idea to put it in a dedicated profile to hide it away.

@lijialing888 SkyWalking has just join the ASF, so we haven't release any version under `org.apache`. You can't download `org.apache.skywalking` from anywhere.

If you want to try our old version, latest 3.2.6, if can download it from release pages,  or you can find from **jcenter**. check here: https://bintray.com/wu-sheng/skywalking/org.skywalking.apm-toolkit-trace
This is a requirement. We haven't supported yet.

This is String based on BASE64 encode, because Elastic Search only accepts bytes in this format. And the bytes are in Protobuf format, after you do the un-BASE64.

SkyWalking segment format is here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/apm-protocol/apm-network/src/main/proto/TraceSegmentService.proto

Sorry for missing your mail. Too many automatic sent mail in our maillist, because we are using GitHub issues to discuss. So free feel to start any discussions here, even the template doesn't fit.

As an OpenTracing supported tracer, also a member of OTIAB, I am not familiar with `MicroProfile OpenTracing spec`. But I saw a familiar name, [@Pavol Loffay](https://github.com/pavolloffay), so I assume some OpenTracing friends are working on the spec.

I just did a quick read about the spec. I am not sure about `How should we support the spec?`. 

Quote from the spec:
```
This specification defines an easy way to allow an application running in a MicroProfile container to take advantage of distributed tracing by using an OpenTracing Tracer implementation.
```

Already as an OpenTracing Tracer implementation, what should we do further more?

@pavolloffay Feel free to join us.

First, I am not very familiar with this project. Is it sort of agent-based tracer right? 

Microprofile basically defines what data (tags, logs) instrumentation should report via OpenTracing tracer. The implementation can use arbitrary OT vendor. 

I think to make it work, users have to just use sky-walking OT tracer :)

> First, I am not very familiar with this project. Is it sort of agent-based tracer right?

Yes, agent based. `@Trace` annotation supported and OpenTracing tracer implementation bridge supported.
Well, there's another piece to it, which is the required CDI/JAX-RS instrumentation.

# Vote Request
Participators: All PPMC members, @ascrutae @hanahmily  @peng-yongsheng @wu-sheng

Content: @zone1511 asks for open the span stack inside TracingContext to plugin developer, for some custom requirements:
> Just image a case if I only want to trace sql performance for certain url only, the jdbc plugin has to check if in the stack there is a span which is a web url type span and check if the url is match or not.
Since the active span only tells you the current span, if you want to trace the whole call stack, there is no option right now unless the contextmanager provides function to expose the active stack

Vote open for at least 3 days.

-1 (binding)

Reason:
1. TracingContext an inside concept, if plugin need to know how core works, make the plugin development harder than before, and also hard to test in all scenario. Either open `TracingContext` or providing `RuntimeContext` is all segment context related, any conjecture codes without fully check may cause a fatal in tracing.
1. It's hard to say how to config these URLs, because we don't have Config downstream(from collector) for now.

@zone1511 Good proposal. And welcome and glad to accept pull request about this. But notice, when you use SPI, please make sure you are using the right classloader, I think should be `AgentClassLoader#getDefault()`
@zone1511 can you take an example about how to switch and your context implementation can fit your requirements.
@zone1511 Even we do that, `TracingContext` or `YourImplementContext` can't be guaranteed existing. e.g. ignored trace.

From plugin side just check if the context is TracingContext or not. If not. Just handle it. 

Sent from my iPhone

Welcome. I am very interested in .NET agent. I can help you with that. If you want a direct chat channel, I recommend you to join our gitter: https://gitter.im/OpenSkywalking/Lobby . 

Let's be clear with some concepts about OpenTracing first, OK?
OpenTracing is just an APIs layer, didn't include any implementation in any language. So for SKyWalking, it is a SDK interfaces only, you can see we just set a bridge in Java: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/tree/master/apm-application-toolkit/apm-toolkit-opentracing/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/toolkit/opentracing

Then, for implement a .NET agent, you should only need to understand our .proto(Google gRPC) protocol, which supports C#: https://grpc.io/docs/

The major concept differences between SkyWalking Core and OpenTracing concepts(only in specification level) are:
1. Seperate Span to Entry/Local/Exit Span. Entry and Exit for RPC server and client side, or MQ consumer and provider side. Local means an ordinary method.
2. SkyWalking sw3 head, which propagates through HTTP or other RPC invocations. The protocol is here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/Skywalking-Cross-Process-Propagation-Headers-Protocol-v1.md.

For further codes reading, I suggest you start here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/apm-sniffer/apm-agent-core/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/agent/core/context/ContextManager.java . This is the entrance of our trace core.
I assume it is @evbasso asking for help.

I can't understand the real things you want. If you only want to trace sql performance for certain url only, you can setting the url matcher. Then the trace from those url are filtered, but you want to filter the sql only. What are your concerns? Save the network io performance?
Ok, perfect! Thanks

Some framework like JSF is hard to set the url filter. But I can create a jsf plugin so when a jsf action is called. It will create a span and if this action call a sql then I can correctly only log sql's related to that jsf action. Which it is mvc framework dependent. So there is a must for the plugin to check the span stack to see if the sql is originate from a target web action.

@wu-sheng I found if I use `AgentClassLoader.getDefault()` in the service loader, it will throws 
```java
java.util.ServiceConfigurationError: org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.jdbc.connectionurl.parser.ConnectionURLParser: Provider org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.jdbc.h2.parser.H2URLParser not a subtype
```
where `ConnectionURLParser` is the SPI interface and `H2URLParser` is the SPI implementation
and debug shows the Concrete class and Service interface are not loaded from `AgentClassLoader.getDefault()` but loaded by another instance of AgentClassLoader
Is this expected?  or I should use the default `load()` method instead specifying the class loader?
@peng-yongsheng The vote is going to end so. Please take a vote.

@zone1511 Sorry for misleading you. You need to push the SPI init later,  maybe use a double-check lock in Interceptor can avoid the classloader problem.

And don't use `AgentClassLoader#getDefault()`, choose to use `Interceptor.class.getClassLoader()` instead(my best guess for now).

> So I just pull request and it will trigger the test or I run junit test locally? but I didnt see any junit test cover spring boot + mysql?

Normal junit test cases doesn't fit most of java agent tests. That is why @ascrutae contribute his auto test solution with docker(-compose) isolation. If @ascrutae hasn't finished all guides/documents, you can ask him directly for guidances.
@zone1511 Before anything happens, I recommend you set your GitHub right. Make your avatar display in commit logs here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/770/commits

@wu-sheng I just found that if the parser is moved to each db plugin, some other class's test case will failed due to the assumption that `URLParser.parser` is not able to parse the corresponding jdbcurl. To make the test run, it must reference to myssql plugin which will cause cyclic reference. Please suggest how to handle those test case which depends on `URLParser.parser`
